author: build4c
content:
Hi, here are some questions about verkle tree proof, I read `gballet/go-verkle` code.

my question is: why proof return so many fileds?  what they means? only proof useful?
`proof, cis, zis, yis, _ := MakeVerkleMultiProof(root, [][]byte{ffx32KeyTest})`

I also found a `SerializeProof(proof *Proof) (*VerkleProof, StateDiff, error)`, what they means?  the stateDiff used to recover state?

see code here: https://github.com/gballet/go-verkle/blob/master/proof_test.go#L44

https://github.com/gballet/go-verkle/blob/master/proof_ipa.go#L151

author: gballet
content:
For the first question, these are the elements needed to construct the proof, as described in this document: https://dankradfeist.de/ethereum/2021/06/18/pcs-multiproofs.html

For the second question, state diff tracks the difference in the state before and after the execution of the block. It is described here: https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/blob/509fbb2c5ca74d93e9d0c3b3532be4c7214e1cd5/specs/_features/verge/beacon-chain.md

content:
Thank you, one more question:
here is a sparse verkle tree, max level is 7, I found the deeper level has larger proof size? I only count serialized proof size. The proof will change in diff level? may 32 byte every level?

author: gballet
content: yes, the proofs get larger as the tree gets deeper as adding one level means adding a new C, yi and zi for each level.
